subject: Data
title: Smart Cities: Urban Data in Action
description: Learn Smart Cities: Urban Data in Action in one minute.

hook.text: Barcelona saved $58 million per year by using sensor data to optimize street lighting and irrigation.

buildup.text: Smart cities use data from traffic cameras, parking sensors, energy grids, and waste bins.

discovery.text: Real-time data lets cities reroute traffic, predict crime hotspots, and deploy ambulances faster.

twist.text: The same sensors that optimize services can also track citizens' movements and habits.

climax.text: Smart cities promise efficiency, but the data they collect raises serious surveillance concerns.

punchline.text: Smart cities know where everyone is, all the time.

quiz.question: What is a major concern about smart city data collection?
